t: Jeremiah 10
God and Idols
Hear*p what the Lord*s says to you, people of Israel.
This is what the Lord*s says: “Do*pn not learn the ways of the nations or*ld be terrified by signs in the heavens, though*ld the nations are terrified by them.
For*ln the practices of the peoples are worthless; they*ld cut a tree out of the forest, and*ld a craftsman shapes it with his chisel.
They*ln adorn it with silver and gold; they*ld fasten it with hammer and nails so*ld it will not totter.
Like*ln a scarecrow in a cucumber field, their*ld idols cannot speak; they*ln must be carried because*ld they cannot walk. Do*ln not fear them; they*ld can do no harm nor*ld can they do any good.”
No*pn one is like you, Lord;*s you*ld are great, and*ld your name is mighty in power.
Who*ln should not fear you, King*ld of the nations? This*ld is your due. Among*ln all the wise leaders of the nations and*ld in all their kingdoms, there*ld is no one like you.
They*pn are all senseless and foolish; they*ld are taught by worthless wooden idols.
Hammered*ln silver is brought from Tarshish and*ld gold from Uphaz. What*ln the craftsman and goldsmith have made is*ld then dressed in blue and purple— all*ld made by skilled workers.
But*ln the Lord*s is the true God; he*ld is the living God, the eternal King. When*ln he is angry, the earth trembles; the*ld nations cannot endure his wrath.
“Tell*p them this: ‘These gods, who did not make the heavens and the earth, will perish from the earth and from under the heavens.’ ”
But*pn God made the earth by his power; he*ld founded the world by his wisdom and*ld stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
When*ln he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; he*ld makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He*ln sends lightning with the rain and*ld brings out the wind from his storehouses.
Everyone*pn is senseless and without knowledge; every*ld goldsmith is shamed by his idols. The*ln images he makes are a fraud; they*ld have no breath in them.
They*ln are worthless, the objects of mockery; when*ld their judgment comes, they will perish.
He*ln who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these, for*ld he is the Maker of all things, including*ln Israel, the people of his inheritance— the*ld Lord*s Almighty is his name.
Coming Destruction
Gather*pn up your belongings to leave the land, you*ld who live under siege.
For*ln this is what the Lord*s says: “At*ld this time I will hurl out those*ld who live in this land; I*ln will bring distress on them so*ld that they may be captured.”
Woe*pn to me because of my injury! My*ld wound is incurable! Yet*ln I said to myself, “This*ld is my sickness, and I must endure it.”
My*ln tent is destroyed; all*ld its ropes are snapped. My*ln children are gone from me and are no more; no*ld one is left now to pitch my tent or*ld to set up my shelter.
The*ln shepherds are senseless and*ld do not inquire of the Lord;*s so*ln they do not prosper and*ld all their flock is scattered.
Listen!*ln The report is coming— a*ld great commotion from the land of the north! It*ln will make the towns of Judah desolate, a*ld haunt of jackals.
Jeremiah’s Prayer
Lord,*spn I know that people’s lives are not their own; it*ld is not for them to direct their steps.
Discipline*ln me, Lord,*s but only in due measure— not*ld in your anger, or*ld you will reduce me to nothing.

Pour*ln out your wrath on the nations that*ld do not acknowledge you, on*ld the peoples who do not call on your name. For*ln they have devoured Jacob; they*ld have devoured him completely and*ld destroyed his homeland.
